hero.title: MORGANE SUPPA
hero.description: Since my earliest steps, I’ve always been drawn to art and video games. Game Design, Level Design, and Level Art quickly became the areas where I felt most at ease. My artistic background blends seamlessly with my technical skills. These artistic abilities form the foundation of my collaborations with other departments—an alliance I believe is essential to bring coherent projects to life. It’s a real pleasure for me to share with you what I’ve created.

about.title: About me
bento1: Having gained my first experiences in the game industry, I began my career at an Escape Game (Secret Door), where I contributed to the design of four competitive escape rooms, a first in France, while also working as a Game Master. I then continued my journey with the independent studio Dreamirl in Toulouse and the studio HammerHead in Bordeaux.
I’m a self-taught artist. I make 2D sprites for game jams and draw for fun.
At the moment, I am developing my own co-op indie video game, which is set to be released by fall 2027.

bento2.title: A few points about me:
content: Graduated in Game Design and Gamification (2020-2023)
Fable The Lost Chapter, Titanfall 2, Ori and The Will Of The Wisps, Apex Legends are my favorite games.
I am currently creating and seeking funding for my own co-op video game.
Self-taught in drawing for over 15 years, I work in both realistic and semi-realistic styles.
A pianist for over 10 years, I also play guitar and sing as well.
Creator of many Role Play universes on Discord.

collaborate.title: Let's collaborate
collaborate.description: If my projects interest you, feel free to reach out. I would be delighted to discuss potential collaborations. Looking forward to working with you!

hero.title: Noreya: The Gold Project
hero.description: Noreya: The Gold Project is a frantic metroidvania game by the Toulouse-based studio Dreamirl, where players must enter a divine conflict where the choice between gold and light will determine their fate.
hero.works: For this project, I worked on Game & Level Design, Narrative Design, and Level Art.

conception.title: Design
description: Design of macro, middle, and micro maps of the 7 different biomes.
Creation of the game's walkthrough.
Placement of events (cinematics, chase scenes, enemy waves...).
Manage the rhythm and difficulty of the levels.
Design of challenges and 'paper' puzzles.

blockout.title: Blockout
description: Worked on levels with gray blocks for playtests and testing mechanics.
Iterations.
Ensure playability of levels and transition between them.
Test puzzles and verify their functionality in challenges.
Collaboration with the DEV team.
Integration of features coded by developers into the world (events, monsters, etc.).
Playtest and bug fixing.

rendu.title: Rendering
description: Collaboration with the ART team.
Feedback on 2D sprites.
Placement and decoration of validated level maps.
Special attention to every detail.
Feedback on assets and props.
Bug fixing.

card1.description: The game offers a rich exploration experience, with vast areas to discover and many secrets to uncover. Throughout their adventure, players will have to face a multitude of varied enemies. Players must skillfully navigate through complex environments while overcoming obstacles to progress in the game.

card2.description: Players must solve puzzles to advance. For this one, they need to learn to use the ghost (a phantom double) to succeed. The player must solve the puzzle to pass to the other side. By using a prayer stele, they can switch places with their bodily double. The key to this puzzle is to alternate between the two forms to progress.

card3.description: Boss fights are divided into multiple phases, each bringing its unique challenges. The final boss of the game marks a return to bullet hell style. Each boss has specific attack patterns, requiring players to constantly adapt their strategies. Noreya's bosses are particularly renowned for their complexity and creativity, with unpredictable attacks, testing both the player's mastery and responsiveness.

card4.title: The Gold Project.
card4.description: The game alternates between exploration, puzzle/challenge phases, and boss fights, offering a varied and engaging experience. Players navigate through six distinct biomes, each with a unique artistic direction carefully crafted in coherence with the level design. These diverse environments are not only visually captivating but also designed to enrich the gameplay. This combination of varied gameplay, supported by an immersive aesthetic, creates a satisfying and memorable gaming experience.

hero.title: Break in the loop
hero.description: Break in the loop is a VR heist escape game where players must work together to gather a big loot in 1920s Chicago, in a famous Speakeasy.
hero.works: For this project, I worked on Game & Level Design as well as Level Art.

conception.title: Design
description: Design of the room layout from a top-down view.
Consideration of gameplay elements to be integrated.
Placement of events and definition of the order of puzzles.
Enhancement of interactivity and entertainment within the level.
In-depth research on historical and architectural context.
References to notable films and books.

blockout.title: Blockout
description: Worked on levels with gray blocks for VR testing.
Ensure playability for people of all sizes within the level.
Test puzzles and verify their functionality within the intended space.
Playtest and bug fixing.
Design of interior layouts based on initial plans.

rendu.title: Rendering
description: Collaboration with the ART team.
Feedback on assets and props.
Modeling of furniture and props needed for levels.
Replacement of temporary mesh blocks.
Special attention to lighting to create an immersive atmosphere.
Bug fixing and visual artifact corrections.

card1.description: Players must find the entrance to the speakeasy hidden in the tailor shop's room. After solving a series of puzzles, they will discover the mannequin's arm. By placing this arm in the right place, they can trigger the mechanism that reveals a hidden staircase, allowing them to access the secret speakeasy.

card2.description: Players must find a way to access the distillery, a sub-area of the speakeasy. Players outside the headset give instructions to the burglars. They will discover clues on a champagne bottle indicating the order of the notes for the piano. Players must continue exploring to find the entrance to the boss's office, where the loot is hidden.

card3.description: Players are close to their final objective. The player wearing the VR headset must now give precise instructions to the players outside so they can solve an off-VR puzzle. This puzzle will provide the necessary code to open the safe. This phase of the game heavily emphasizes cooperation, requiring effective communication between players to successfully unlock the safe and reach their loot.

card4.title: The perfect break-in.
card4.description: The game's gameplay consists of searching through different rooms to discover puzzles and clues. These puzzles, once solved, allow players to progress to the next room and reach the loot. Players not wearing the headset have their own set of clues to analyze in correlation with those found in the game. By pooling their clues together, they can deduce the steps needed to solve the puzzles.
